snippet: A federal judge ruled that Garden City’s zoning change that favored the building of single-family homes over modestly priced apartments in 2004 “tended to perpetuate segregation.”
abstract: Federal judge rules that predominantly white village of Garden City, LI, intentionally discriminated against blacks and Hispanics when it enacted zoning change in 2004 favoring building of townhouses or single-family homes over modestly priced apartments.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled that Garden City’s zoning change that favored the building of single-family homes over modestly priced apartments in 2004 “tended to perpetuate segregation.”

headline.main: Long Island Village Intentionally Discriminated Against Minorities, Judge Says
headline.print_headline: Long Island Village Intentionally Discriminated Against Minorities, Judge Says
